com.bluegosling.concurrent.fluent

Interface Rescheduler<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of future value for which a subsequent calculation may be rescheduled
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface Rescheduler<T>
    Handles rescheduling a periodic task. This computes the next scheduled execution time for a repeating task. An interface provides greater flexibility than does simple API where the only options for repeating tasks are to run at a fixed rate or with a fixed delay. Complicated recurring schedules can be implemented this way.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Rescheduler<Object> atFixedRate(long period, TimeUnit unit)
      Creates a rescheduler that schedules tasks at a fixed rate.
      static Rescheduler<Object> atFixedRateSkippingMissedOccurrences(long period, TimeUnit unit)
      Creates a rescheduler that schedules tasks at a fixed rate.
      long computeNextStartTime(FluentRepeatingFuture<? extends T> future, long priorStartTimeNanos)
      Computes the next scheduled execution time for a repeating task, in system nano-time.
      static long getFixedDelayNanos(Rescheduler<?> rescheduler)
      Returns the fixed delay, in nanoseconds, used by the given rescheduler.
      static long getFixedRatePeriodNanos(Rescheduler<?> rescheduler)
      Returns the fixed period, in nanoseconds, used by the given rescheduler.
      static Rescheduler<Object> withFixedDelay(long delay, TimeUnit unit)
      Creates a rescheduler that schedules tasks with a fixed delay between the end of one task and the beginning of the next.

    • Method Detail

      • computeNextStartTime

        long computeNextStartTime(FluentRepeatingFuture<? extends T> future,
                          long priorStartTimeNanos)
        Computes the next scheduled execution time for a repeating task, in system nano-time.
        Parameters:
        future - the task that completed and is being rescheduled
        priorStartTimeNanos - the start time, in nano-time, of the previously scheduled occurrence of the task
        Returns:
        the new start time, in nano-time, for the next scheduled occurrence of the task

      • getFixedDelayNanos

        static long getFixedDelayNanos(Rescheduler<?> rescheduler)
        Returns the fixed delay, in nanoseconds, used by the given rescheduler. If the given rescheduler was not created with withFixedDelay(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit) then this returns zero.
        Parameters:
        rescheduler - a rescheduler
        Returns:
        the fixed delay, in nanoseconds, used by the given rescheduler or zero if it does not reschedule tasks with a fixed delay

      • withFixedDelay

        static Rescheduler<Object> withFixedDelay(long delay,
                                          TimeUnit unit)
        Creates a rescheduler that schedules tasks with a fixed delay between the end of one task and the beginning of the next.
        Parameters:
        delay - the delay between tasks
        unit - the delay unit
        Returns:
        a rescheduler that schedules tasks with a fixed delay between tasks

      • getFixedRatePeriodNanos

        static long getFixedRatePeriodNanos(Rescheduler<?> rescheduler)
        Returns the fixed period, in nanoseconds, used by the given rescheduler. If the given rescheduler was not created with atFixedRate(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit) or atFixedRateSkippingMissedOccurrences(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit) then this returns zero.
        Parameters:
        rescheduler - a rescheduler
        Returns:
        the fixed period, in nanoseconds, used by the given rescheduler or zero if it does not reschedule tasks at a fixed rate

      • atFixedRateSkippingMissedOccurrences

        static Rescheduler<Object> atFixedRateSkippingMissedOccurrences(long period,
                                                                TimeUnit unit)
        Creates a rescheduler that schedules tasks at a fixed rate. If invocations of the task run too slowly and fall behind the fixed rate, any missed invocations will be skipped, and the schedule will not be allowed to catch up.
        Parameters:
        period - the period between task starts
        unit - the delay unit
        Returns:
        a rescheduler that schedules tasks at a fixed rate

      • atFixedRate

        static Rescheduler<Object> atFixedRate(long period,
                                       TimeUnit unit)
        Creates a rescheduler that schedules tasks at a fixed rate. If invocations of the task run too slowly and fall behind the fixed rate, they may be scheduled more frequently so the task can catch up.
        Parameters:
        period - the period between task starts
        unit - the delay unit
        Returns:
        a rescheduler that schedules tasks at a fixed rate
